intro: Galium richardianum subsp. haenkeanum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant typically features slender, prostrate stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
